column2: As part of the Infosys delivery team, your primary role would be to interface with the client for quality assurance, issue resolution and ensuring high customer satisfaction. You will understand requirements, create and review designs, validate the architecture and ensure high levels of service offerings to clients in the technology domain. You will participate in project estimation, provide inputs for solution delivery, conduct technical risk planning, perform code reviews and unit test plan reviews. You will lead and guide your teams towards developing optimized high quality code deliverables, continual knowledge management and adherence to the organizational guidelines and processes. You would be a key contributor to building efficient programs/ systems and if you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you!If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you! column2: Technical Author Job description Develop documentation using Microsoft Word, based on RM s guidelines and house style. Creating and editing pictures and diagrams as necessary as part of the documentation. Collating and verifying information needed to create documentation, primarily through independent use and investigation of solutions. Liaise with Product Managers, Product Owners and Software Engineers as needed to support product knowledge and clarify required information. Work on project teams to meet agreed timescales. The job holder is responsible for the technical, grammatical and typographical accuracy of the documented information and for working with internal teams to ensure that documentation is appropriately reviewed. Provide expertise and editorial support to other Technical Authors and other RM staff. Experience A Technical Author must have excellent communication skills, and the ability to work closely with key stakeholders and internal teams. In addition, they will have: Advanced Microsoft Word skills Good verbal skills and excellent written communication skills Ability to structure information in a logical order and to turn technical information into plain English Strong focus on detail Ability to understand the functionality of complex, technical products Ability to think critically to consider beyond standard modes of use for complex products and suggest potential product improvements Ability to work to a schedule and meet deadlines Good interpersonal/team working skills Ability to prioritise and balance own workload

column2: Experience with Catia V5 proficient in part design, surface, Sheet metal, Drafting & Assembly workbenches.  Experience with Structural parts, Composites, Sheet metal and plastics parts with respect to galley design knowledge on trim and finishes.  Experience with trolleys design and Inserts ( Oven, Beverage Maker etc.) used in Galleys. Basic Knowledge on plumbing design and electrical Harness. Hands on experience with ECR and Change Order process. Expert in Drafting and implementing changes arising from production with quick  TAT.
